standard_metadata.standard_description: Relate volume to the operations of multiplication and addition and solve real world and mathematical problems involving volume.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Understanding decomposing figures to find volume

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 8 centimeters height.

options.content: $(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD9\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD2\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD5\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD5\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD2\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD9\text{ cm})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 8 centimeters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE2\text{ cm}, \blueE9\text{ cm}$ and $\blueE5\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\purpleD8\text{ cm}, \purpleD9\text{ cm}$ and $\purpleD1\text{ cm}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD9\text{ cm}\times\purpleD1\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 9 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 8 centimeters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE9\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}\times\purpleD9\text{ cm})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 5 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 10 centimeters height.

options.content: $(\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE{12}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD3\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{12}\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE{12}\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD3\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm} \times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm}) $
$(\blueE{12}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD5\text{ cm}\times\purpleD3\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 5 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 10 centimeters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE5\text{ cm}, \blueE{12}\text{ cm}$ and $\blueE5\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE{12}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 5 centimeters height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\purpleD{12}\text{ cm}, \purpleD{10}\text{ cm}$ and $\purpleD3\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\purpleD{12}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD3\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 12 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 10 centimeters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\blueE5\text{ cm}\times\blueE{12}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD3\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{10}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{12}\text{ cm})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 7 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 6 centimeters height.

options.content: $(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE{8}\text{ cm}\times\blueE7\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{6}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{8}\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE7\text{ cm} \times\blueE6\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{6}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{8}\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE1\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{6}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{8}\text{ cm})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 7 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 6 centimeters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE2\text{ cm}, \blueE{8}\text{ cm}$ and $\blueE7\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE{8}\text{ cm}\times\blueE7\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 7 centimeters width by 2 centimeters height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\purpleD{8}\text{ cm}, \purpleD{6}\text{ cm}$ and $\purpleD1\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\purpleD{1}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{6}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD8\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 8 centimeters length by 1 centimeter width by 6 centimeters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\blueE2\text{ cm}\times\blueE{8}\text{ cm}\times\blueE7\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD1\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{6}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{8}\text{ cm})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 1 centimeter height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 4 centimeter width by 7 centimeters height.

options.content: $(\goldE1\text{ cm}\times\goldE{5}\text{ cm}\times\goldE3\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD4\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{7}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{5}\text{ cm})$
$(\goldE1\text{ cm}\times\goldE{4}\text{ cm}\times\goldE3\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD4\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{7}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{5}\text{ cm})$
$(\goldE1\text{ cm}\times\goldE{7}\text{ cm}\times\goldE3\text{ cm})+ (\purpleD4\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{7}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{5}\text{ cm})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 1 centimeter height. The second rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 7 centimeters width by 4 centimeters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\goldE1\text{ cm}, \goldE{5}\text{ cm}$ and $\goldE3\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\goldE1\text{ cm}\times\goldE{5}\text{ cm}\times\goldE3\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The gold rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 1 centimeter height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\purpleD{5}\text{ cm}, \purpleD{7}\text{ cm}$ and $\purpleD4\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\purpleD{4}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{7}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD5\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 4 centimeters width by 7 centimeters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\goldE1\text{ cm}\times\goldE{5}\text{ cm}\times\goldE3\text{ cm}) + (\purpleD4\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{7}\text{ cm}\times\purpleD{5}\text{ cm})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 5 centimeters length by 7 centimeters width by 3 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 8 centimeters height by 3 centimeter width by 7 inches length.

options.content: $(\blueE3\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\goldE3\text{ cm}\times\goldE{7}\text{ cm}\times\goldE{8}\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE3\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\goldE3\text{ cm}\times\goldE{3}\text{ cm}\times\goldE{8}\text{ cm})$
$(\blueE3\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) +(\goldE3\text{ cm}\times\goldE{5}\text{ cm}\times\goldE{8}\text{ cm})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 7 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 3 centimeters height. The second rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 7 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 8 centimeters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE3\text{ cm}, \blueE{7}\text{ cm}$ and $\blueE5\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE3\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 7 centimeters length by 5 centimeters width by 3 centimeters height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\goldE{3}\text{ cm}, \goldE{8}\text{ cm}$ and $\goldE7\text{ cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\goldE{3}\text{ cm}\times\goldE{7}\text{ cm}\times\goldE8\text{ cm}$.

images.alt: The gold rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 7 centimeters length by 3 centimeters width by 8 centimeters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\blueE3\text{ cm}\times\blueE{7}\text{ cm}\times\blueE5\text{ cm}) + (\goldE3\text{ cm}\times\goldE{7}\text{ cm}\times\goldE{8}\text{ cm})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 2 meters width by 4 meters height. The second rectangular prism is maroon and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 3 meters width by 7 meters height.

options.content: $(\blueE4\text{ m}\times\blueE6\text{ m}\times\blueE2\text{ m}) + (\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m})$
$(\blueE4\text{ m}\times\blueE7\text{ m}\times\blueE2\text{ m}) + (\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m})$
$(\blueE4\text{ m}\times\blueE3\text{ m}\times\blueE2\text{ m}) + (\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m})$

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms.  The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 2 meters width by 4 meters height. The second rectangular prism is maroon and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 3 meters width by 7 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE4\text{ m}, \blueE6\text{ m}$ and $\blueE2\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE4\text{ m}\times\blueE6\text{ m}\times\blueE2\text{ m}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 4 meters length by 6 meters width by 2 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has dimensions of $\maroonE6\text{ m}, \maroonE7\text{ m}$ and $\maroonE3\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m}$.

images.alt: The maroon rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 3 meters width by 7 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $(\blueE4\text{ m}\times\blueE6\text{ m}\times\blueE2\text{ m}) + (\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m})$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 2 meters length by 6 meters width by 3 meters height. The second rectangular prism is orange and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 6 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 2 meters length by 6 meters width by 3 meters height. The second rectangular prism is orange and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 6 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has the dimensions of $\purpleD3\text{ m}, \purpleD6\text{ m}$ and $\purpleD2\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\purpleD3\text{ m}\times\purpleD6\text{ m}\times\purpleD2\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\purpleD{36}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above has the dimensions 2 meters length by 6 meters width by 3 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\goldE6\text{ m}, \goldE{10}\text{ m}$ and $\goldE6\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\goldE6\text{ m}\times\goldE{10}\text{ m}\times\goldE6\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\goldE{360}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The orange rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 6 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\purpleD{36} \text{ cubic meters}+\goldE{360}\text{ cubic meters}$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 5 meters length by 4 meters width by 3 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 5 meters length by 2 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 5 meters length by 4 meters width by 3 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 5 meters length by 2 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE3\text{ m}, \blueE{4}\text{ m}$ and $\blueE5\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE3\text{ m}\times\blueE{4}\text{ m}\times\blueE5\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\blueE{60}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has  the dimensions 5 meters length by 4 meters width by 3 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\maroonE5\text{ m}, \maroonE{10}\text{ m}$ and $\maroonE2\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\maroonE5\text{ m}\times\maroonE{10}\text{ m}\times\maroonE{2}\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\maroonE{100}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The pink rectangular prism from above is shown and has  the dimensions 5 meters length by 2 meters width by 10 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\blueE{60} \text{ cubic meters}+\maroonE{100}\text{ cubic meters}$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 8 meters width by 2 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 8 meters width by 2 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has the dimensions of $\goldE2\text{ m}, \goldE6\text{ m}$ and $\goldE8\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\goldE2\text{ m}\times\goldE6\text{ m}\times\goldE8\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\goldE{96}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The gold rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 8 meters width by 2 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\maroonE6\text{ m}, \maroonE{8}\text{ m}$ and $\maroonE5\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\maroonE6\text{ m}\times\maroonE{8}\text{ m}\times\maroonE5\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\maroonE{240}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The pink rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 6 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\goldE{96} \text{ cubic meters}+\maroonE{240}\text{ cubic meters}$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is blue and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 1 meter width by 2 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is blue and has dimensions 7 meters length by 1 meters width by 2 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has dimensions of $\blueE2\text{ m}, \blueE{7}\text{ m}$ and $\blueE1\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\blueE2\text{ m}\times\blueE7\text{ m}\times\blueE1\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\blueE{14}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The blue rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 1 meters width by 2 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\maroonE5\text{ m}, \maroonE8\text{ m}$ and $\maroonE7\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\maroonE5\text{ m}\times\maroonE8\text{ m}\times\maroonE7\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\maroonE{280}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The pink rectangular prism from above is shown and has  the dimensions 7 meters length by 5 meters width by 8 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\blueE{14} \text{ cubic meters}+\maroonE{280}\text{ cubic meters}$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular prisms. Color is used to show the rectangular prisms that make up the figure. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 8 meters width by 4 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 3 meters width by 9 meters height.

hints.content: To find the volume of a rectangular prism, we multiply the $\text{length}\times\text{height}\times{\text{width}}$.
Let's break the figure into $2$ parts.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is gold and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 8 meters width by 4 meters height. The second rectangular prism is pink and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 3 meters width by 9 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has the dimensions of $\goldE4\text{ m}, \goldE7\text{ m}$ and $\goldE8\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\goldE4\text{ m}\times\goldE7\text{ m}\times\goldE8\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\goldE{224}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The gold rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 7 meters length by 8 meters width by 4 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\maroonE7\text{ m}, \maroonE{9}\text{ m}$ and $\maroonE3\text{ m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\maroonE7\text{ m}\times\maroonE{9}\text{ m}\times\maroonE3\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\maroonE{189}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The pink rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions dimensions 7 meters length by 3 meters width by 9 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\goldE{224} \text{ cubic meters}+\maroonE{189}\text{ cubic meters}$

question.content: The figure below is made up of two rectangular prisms.     **Which expression can be used to find the volume of the figure?**

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms. The first rectangular prism is purple and has the dimensions 5 meters length by 4 meters width by 3 meters height. The second rectangular prism is orange and has the dimensions 8 meters length by 4 meters width by 6 meters height.

hints.content: The first prism has the dimensions of $\purpleD3\text{ m}, \purpleD4\text{ m}$ and $\purpleD5\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we multiply $\purpleD3\text{ m}\times\purpleD4\text{ m}\times\purpleD5\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\purpleD{60}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The purple rectangular prism from above has the dimensions 5 meters length by 4 meters width by 3 meters height.

hints.content: The second prism has the dimensions of $\goldE6\text{ m}, \goldE{8}\text{ m}$ and $\goldE4\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  So, to find the volume we use the expression $\goldE6\text{ m}\times\goldE{8}\text{ m}\times\goldE4\text{ m}$.  The volume for this prism is $\goldE{192}\text{ cubic meters}$.

images.alt: The orange rectangular prism from above is shown and has the dimensions 8 meters length by 4 meters width by 6 meters height.

hints.content: To find the total volume, we add both volumes together.  $\purpleD{60} \text{ cubic meters}+\goldE{192}\text{ cubic meters}$
